member.name: T:Loom.Nethereum.KeyStore.Crypto.SCrypt
member.summary: Implementation of the scrypt a password-based key derivation function.
member.remarks: Scrypt was created by Colin Percival and is specified in draft-josefsson-scrypt-kd.

member.name: M:Loom.Nethereum.KeyStore.Crypto.SCrypt.Generate(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Generate a key using the scrypt key derivation function.
member.param: the bytes of the pass phrase.
the salt to use for this invocation.
CPU/Memory cost parameter. Must be larger than 1, a power of 2 and less than 2^(128 * r / 8).
Parallelization parameter. Must be a positive integer less than or equal to Int32.MaxValue / (128 * r * 8).
the length of the key to generate.

members.member:
BigNumber based on the original http://uberscraper.blogspot.co.uk/2013/09/c-bigdecimal-class-from-stackoverflow.html which was inspired by http://stackoverflow.com/a/4524254 Original Author: Jan Christoph Bernack (contact: jc.bernack at googlemail.com) Changes JB: Added parse, Fix Normalise, Added Floor, New ToString, Change Equals (normalise to validate first), Change Casting to avoid overflows (even if might be slower), Added Normalise Bigger than zero, test on operations, parsing, casting, and other test coverage for ethereum unit conversions Changes KJ: Added Culture formatting http://stackoverflow.com/a/13813535/956364" />
Arbitrary precision Decimal. All operations are exact, except for division. Division never determines more digits than the given precision of 50.

member.name: F:Loom.Nethereum.Util.BigDecimal.Precision
member.summary: Sets the maximum precision of division operations. If AlwaysTruncate is set to true all operations are affected.

member.name: M:Loom.Nethereum.Util.BigDecimal.#ctor(System.Numerics.BigInteger,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.param: The number of decimal units for example (-18). A positive value will be normalised as 10 ^ exponent
Specifies whether the significant digits should be truncated to the given precision after each operation.

member.name: M:Loom.Nethereum.Util.BigDecimal.Normalize
member.summary: Removes trailing zeros on the mantissa

member.name: M:Loom.Nethereum.Util.BigDecimal.Truncate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Truncate the number to the given precision by removing the least significant digits.

member.name: M:Loom.Nethereum.Util.BigDecimal.Floor
member.summary: Truncate the number, removing all decimal digits.

member.name: M:Loom.Nethereum.Util.BigDecimal.AlignExponent(Loom.Nethereum.Util.BigDecimal,Loom.Nethereum.Util.BigDecimal)
member.summary: Returns the mantissa of value, aligned to the exponent of reference. Assumes the exponent of value is larger than of value.

member.name: M:Loom.Nethereum.Util.ByteUtil.AppendByte(System.Byte[],System.Byte)
member.summary: Creates a copy of bytes and appends b to the end of it

member.name: M:Loom.Nethereum.Util.UnitConversion.FromWei(System.Numerics.BigInteger,System.Numerics.BigInteger)
member.summary: Converts from wei to a unit, NOTE: When the total number of digits is bigger than 29 they will be rounded the less significant digits

member.name: M:Loom.Nethereum.Util.UnitConversion.FromWei(System.Numerics.BigInteger,Loom.Nethereum.Util.UnitConversion.EthUnit)
member.summary: Converts from wei to a unit, NOTE: When the total number of digits is bigger than 29 they will be rounded the less significant digits

member.name: M:Loom.Nethereum.Util.UnitConversion.FromWei(System.Numerics.BigInteger,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts from wei to a unit, NOTE: When the total number of digits is bigger than 29 they will be rounded the less significant digits
